field_edited_text.value:
38 SUSQUEHANNA RIVER BRIDGE

bridge will commence in January, 1940, and be completed during June,
1940. Painting will be done during months of March, April, May and June,
1940.

The contracts for Approach Highways and Toll Booths, Administration
Building, Ete. can be executed very readily, as indicated by the schedule,
during the time from September, 1939, to May, 1940, thus assuring the com-
pletion of the bridge, ready for traffic, no later than June 30, 1940.

ESTIMATED COST OF BRIDGE AND APPROACHES

The estimated cost of bridge and approaches is separated into the follow-
ing divisions, summarized as follows in Table 7.



TABLE 7
Summary of estimated cost of bridge and approaches
A. Preliminary EXpenses. ............oo $35,000
B. Land, Rights-of-Way, Property Damages, Ete......... ... ... ... ... ... . ... ...... 106,000
C. Construction Cost:

Approach Highways. ... . 106,792
Toll Booths, Administration Building, Ete......................... ... 95,605
CONEITIEENCIEE, v v s 5 suen & S SRS 0 Bubls 3 S b e o Bl Syeres o 15 e 125,778
Total CottStRuetIon CoBb. aum v o s wes wm es 505 5 16 5 Siemes 5088 556§ & 507 200 5 HHS 2157 5 535 5 4,188,000
D. Engineering, Architectural and other Fees for Technical Service...................... 270,000
E. Legal, Administrative, and Overhead Costs.......................c.cciiiiiniiinn.. 40,000



Total estimated cost of bridge and approaches, exclusive of interest during con-
struction and bond discount ............. .. $4,639,000



Following are itemized summaries of quantities and itemized estimates
of costs used in the determination of costs as compiled above in Table 7.

A. Preliminary expenses

The estimated preliminary expenses, herein listed under Table 8, include
the expense of survey work, core and wash borings, traffic census and report,
and legal and administrative work incurred to the present time and the cost
